18.title: "Freak Show"

notes: "To be continued."

19.title: "Freak Show"
19.author: written by Bruce Jones ; illustrated by Berni Wrightson ; colored by Michelle Wrightson
19.appears_in: p. 11-16 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 6 (Sept. 1982).
notes: "The story so far: A brightly decorated wagon pulled into a small town at the height of a severe rain storm. The driver, a gaunt figure in black, began to tell the townspeople of a similar person who, years earlier, undertook the 'collecting' of lonely and deformed people, the lost children of the world."
To be continued.

20.title: "Freak Show"
20.author: written by Bruce Jones ; illustrated by Berni Wrightson ; colored by Michelle Wrightson
20.appears_in: p. 12-18 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 7 (Oct. 1982).
notes: "The story so far: The dark stranger told of Lila who, in running from her past, stumbled upon 'Valker's Wretches.' They lived together, the lithe, blonde woman named Lila, the tall, dark-bearded man named Valker. They lived with Deja the frog-girl and Robin the bird-boy and Posie the pinhead and Wilhelm the worm and George and Zigmund and all the other misshapen freaks of nature who followed them."
"To be continued."

21.title: "Freak Show"
21.author: by Bruce Jones ; illustrated by Berni Wrightson
21.appears_in: p. 81-89 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 8 (Nov. 1982).
notes: "The story so far: The townspeople continued to listen to the mysterious stranger's tale of Valker and his wretches. Valker had awakened from a drunken stupor, hoping to see his newborn child for the first time. He beheld a horribly deformed baby girl, and became enraged."
"To be continued."

22.title: "Freak Show"
22.author: by Bruce Jones ; illustrated by Berni Wrightson
22.appears_in: p. 78-84 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 9 (Dec. 1982).

23.title: "Freak Show"
23.author: by Bruce Jones ; illustrated by Berni Wrightson
23.appears_in: p. 56-61 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 10 (Jan. 1983).
notes: "The story so far: The townspeople listened intently to the tale of Valker, who had made a most horrifying discovery."
Final episode.

119.series: June 7, 1945) Original comic art : sample collection of artwork for various U.S. comic strips.
notes: ca. 40 items in box 63 x 53 x 9 cm.
Assembled from various acquisitions of the Russel B. Nye Popular Culture Collection at the Michigan State University Libraries .

The Wizard of Id (Brant Parker & Johnny Hart), 1/4/?? (Sunday). 1. Newspaper comic strips. I. [Each strip title and date]. II. [Each creator] Call no.: oversize PN6726 .O7

120.title: Freckles and His Friends
120.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles and Lard bring in the ringleader of the SKITT club, the BTO (Big Time Operator) Yoohoo, and a picture of her with the Police Chief sleeping in baby clothes.

121.title: Freckles and His Friends
121.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda an June want Lard and Freck to step in puddles so the girls will know how deep they are.

122.title: Freckles and His Friends
122.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard and Freckles feel like saps, and go to ask Freckles' dad how long it will take to become men and put women in their places; they find Pop unhappily wearing a dress while his wife pins the hem.

123.title: Freckles and His Friends
123.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: An outdoor orator, apparently from a college fraternity, addresses a group of boys about boycotting women, and pauses in his speech to do some ogling.

124.title: Freckles and His Friends
124.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The boys are organizing a 'Woman-Haters, Incorporated' and plan to ignore the girls for a whole week; a straw man hanging from a tree in front of the frat house has a sign, 'I Talked with a Girl'.

125.title: Freckles and His Friends
125.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda and June discuss the 'no females allowed' attitude of the fraternity guys, and then Freckles and Lard pointedly ignore them.

126.title: Freckles and His Friends
126.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: In a formal meeting, with girly pin-ups on the walls, Freckles presents a resolution to introduce Woman-Hating Week in Shadyside, and mom comes in with sandwiches.

127.title: Freckles and His Friends
127.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The girls talk about coping with Woman-Hating Week, and decide to lose the rumpus rags and dress up.

128.title: Freckles and His Friends
128.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: A girl drops a handkerchief and Lard picks it up in spite of himself.

129.title: Freckles and His Friends
129.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard has sniffed a hanky during Woman-Hating Week, and the guys prepare for a trial by submersion.

130.title: Freckles and His Friends
130.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard's body doesn't come up for two minutes, and they spot the soda straw he's been breathing through.

131.title: Freckles and His Friends
131.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard Smith has looked at a girl during Woman-Hating Week, and for punishment the boys put him in a hair dryer at the beauty salon.

132.title: Freckles and His Friends
132.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles is making himself unattractive for Woman-Hating Week, and vows not to shave; little brother Tag offers to help him count his mustache. 'Pipe down, Twerp,' says Freckles.

133.title: Freckles and His Friends
133.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: There's a new girl in town, and Lard and Freckles decide to look her over as a test of their will power, since it's still Woman-Hating Week.

134.title: Freckles and His Friends
134.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The new girl is named Pat Owen, and Tag knows all about her, for when he gets older.

135.title: Freckles and His Friends
135.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Tag (the "seeing-eye wolf") reports descriptively on the new girl, while Lard and Freckles wear dark glasses and stick to the vows of Woman-Hating Week.

136.title: Freckles and His Friends
136.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Pat Owen comes out of the drugstore and we hear a wolf whistle; it's the peanut vendor, but Lard almost gets blamed and drummed out of the corps: It's still Woman-Hating Week.

137.title: Freckles and His Friends
137.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda Grubble and June Wayman introduce themselves to Pat Owen, the new girl, and begin to explain Woman-Hating Week.

138.title: Freckles and His Friends
138.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Pat has a flat tire in front of Lard's house, and because it's Woman-Hating Week he changes her tire blindfolded.

139.title: Freckles and His Friends
139.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard changes the tire and explains Woman-Hating Week, Pat invites him to her house and he seems tempted, and then the girls head to Freckles' house to let the air out of another tire.

140.title: Freckles and His Friends
140.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles changes Pat's tire without looking at her, and she gives him a sniff of her perfume in case he wants to track her down.

141.title: Freckles and His Friends
141.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard struggles with his conscience, then decides to ring Pat's doorbell in spite of its being Woman-Hating Week.

142.title: Freckles and His Friends
142.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Pat has a souvenir poster about Woman-Hating Week in her front window.

143.title: Freckles and His Friends
143.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Summary: Lard and Pat are dancing, when Lard hears footsteps.

144.title: Freckles and His Friends
144.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard has to hide so he won't be caught with a girl, so Pat locks him in the basement.

145.title: Freckles and His Friends
145.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard's and Freckles' parents are on the phone at 3 A.M. looking for their missing sons.

146.title: Freckles and His Friends
146.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The police have a long list of missing boys, and the girls don't know where the boys are, because it's Woman-Hating Week.

147.title: Freckles and His Friends
147.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Eight AM, still Woman-Hating Week, and no boys anywhere. Hilda and June think to ask Pat Owen.

148.title: Freckles and His Friends
148.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Pat's been locking them up in the basement and they successively violated the rules of Woman-Hating Week.

149.title: Freckles and His Friends
149.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The girls gloat over the basement full of 'woman-haters.'

150.title: Freckles and His Friends
150.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Kingston McKee, the only non-violator of the rules of Woman-Hating Week, calls for a trial.

151.title: Freckles and His Friends
151.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Kingston declares the other guys guilty, while the girls secretly watch.

152.title: Freckles and His Friends
152.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Though sentenced to a ducking in the river, the defendants demand a jury trial.

153.title: Freckles and His Friends
153.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The transgressors outnumber the righteous, and so Kingston gets the ducking in the river.

154.title: Freckles and His Friends
154.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard shows up on Hilda's doorstep and is rebuffed; she's a woman-hater now: A woman who hates wasting time on him.

155.title: Freckles and His Friends
155.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda's father plans an amphibious assault on the skirt patrol at his front window.

156.title: Freckles and His Friends
156.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda tells Lard to go back to woman-hating, and Hilda's dad douses lard with a pitcher of water.

157.title: Freckles and His Friends
157.author: Merrill Blosser
157.appears_in: p. 226 in The National Cartoonists Society Album 1988 ed.
notes: Summary: Hilda is giving Lard the frost treatment.

158.title: Freckles and His Friends
158.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles and Lard buzz the field on the first day of school, and see a new girl, unescorted.

159.title: Freckles and His Friends
159.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard and Freckles whistle at the new girl in the schoolyard, and she's talking to Mr. Wilson the principal.

160.title: Freckles and His Friends
160.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The Mr. Wilson informs Freck and Lard that they've whistled at Miss Darcy, the new social science teacher. He's glad they approve of the faculty, but gives them a warning.

161.title: Freckles and His Friends
161.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles gets a report card from Miss Darcy, grading his diplomacy, whistling, and effort. His last name is McGoosey.

162.title: Freckles and His Friends
162.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Miss Darcy has no apparent sense of humor, until she reveals her new wall decoration, a print of Whistler's Mother.

163.title: Freckles and His Friends
163.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The new teacher, Miss Darcy, asks Freckles and Lard to stay after class.

164.title: Freckles and His Friends
164.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Miss Darcy the teacher wants Lard and Freckles to think of her as a friend.

165.title: Freckles and His Friends
165.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Miss Darcy says whistling at women might be the wrong idea, and that perhaps they should let women do some of the pursuing.

166.title: Freckles and His Friends
166.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles' dad responds to Miss Darcy's advice by quoting an old saying, 'A man pursues a woman until she catches him'.

167.title: Freckles and His Friends
167.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard wonders why he always gets socked for the hamburger. ("Don't be silly, the man always pays!") Freckles remembers what Miss Darcy said, and declares a revolution.

168.title: Freckles and His Friends
168.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: A poster announcing TWIRP Season appears, and one of the girls says, 'If this is another one of those male revolts like woman-hating week, I'll simply scream!'

169.title: Freckles and His Friends
169.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Girl spies learn about TWIRP Season while a mysterious night meeting goes on in the boys' gym.

170.title: Freckles and His Friends
170.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard says that under duress, all he told them was that TWIRP was "PRIWT" spelled backwards; then they catch Midge, one of the girl spies.

171.title: Freckles and His Friends
171.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles makes Midge take dictation of a TWIRP Season manifesto. "To Whom it May Concern: This is to announce a revolt of all red-blooded males. Henceforth, none of us will take a pigeon out during TWIRP Season unless she pays the bills!"

172.title: Freckles and His Friends
172.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The girls find out what TWIRP means: The Woman is Requested to Pay.

173.title: Freckles and His Friends
173.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: TWIRP Season starts at noon and lasts 15 days; Hilda runs up a bill at 9 AM and hands it to Lard. "Call me up in about fifteen days," she says.

174.title: Freckles and His Friends
174.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The popular girls don't like TWIRP Season ("the most revolting idea since the atomic bomb," etc.). The other girls like it.

175.title: Freckles and His Friends
175.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Norma Lee, the campus glamour puss, has made a date with Nutty Cook.

176.title: Freckles and His Friends
176.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Norma takes Nutty parking, and he doesn't want to cooperate just because she bought him a movie and a hamburger.

177.title: Freckles and His Friends
177.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Norma's plan was to teach Nutty a lesson about being a wolf, which he has never been, but he learns quick.

178.title: Freckles and His Friends
178.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Norma's TWIRP Season role-reversal lesson has backfired, and Nutty comes home from the date talking about his etchings.

179.title: Freckles and His Friends
179.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Nutty now has a reputation, and gets another call for a date, from Betty.

180.title: Freckles and His Friends
180.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard and Freckles try to learn from Nutty's example, and play hard to get.

181.title: Freckles and His Friends
181.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard loses a date with Ingrid by playing too hard to get.

182.title: Freckles and His Friends
182.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: June and Hilda express their resolve not to make any dates during TWIRP Season, and end up deciding to go the cemetery and watch snails.

183.title: Freckles and His Friends
183.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard and Freckles have second thoughts about TWIRP Season, but then they see a violator being punished for calling a girl.

184.title: Freckles and His Friends
184.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles and Lard try to convince Hilda and June that TWIRP Season was not their idea.

185.title: Freckles and His Friends
185.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Brawny grabs Lard's nose and lectures him about the rules of TWIRP Season, and then Flossie Fidge gives them a wolf whistle.

186.title: Freckles and His Friends
186.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles and Lard flip a coin to see who answers Flossie's wolf call.

187.title: Freckles and His Friends
187.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Flossie, taking advantage of women's rights during TWIRP Season, invites Lard to the Northridge Hotel in Larkspur for dinner, and Lard is impressed.

188.title: Freckles and His Friends
188.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Flossie Fidge sends her chauffer, Westgate, to pick up Lard.

189.title: Freckles and His Friends
189.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard isn't used to riding in limousines.

190.title: Freckles and His Friends
190.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard wants Westgate to drive by Hilda's house and honk, but then Hilda passes them in another limousine.

191.title: Freckles and His Friends
191.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Flossie has arranged to have dinner at the hotel, and Nutty Cook turns up also.

192.title: Freckles and His Friends
192.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The whole gang is at the swank Northridge Hotel, including Hilda.

193.title: Freckles and His Friends
193.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The waiters wonder if the boys can afford the extravagant things they're ordering, since they're in the donuts and coffee bracket, but the girls are financing the evening. And the menu is in French.

194.title: Freckles and His Friends
194.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard is relieved when Flossie says she has the money to cover the check.

195.title: Freckles and His Friends
195.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Flossie fakes a faint, which is the signal for all the girls to gather in the powder room.

196.title: Freckles and His Friends
196.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The girls have been in the powder room for a long time, and the management delivers the dinner checks.

197.title: Freckles and His Friends
197.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The powder room is empty. The girls have left the boys with the dinner checks.

198.title: Freckles and His Friends
198.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The girls have taken a stand to put an end to TWIRP Season; one of them wants to go back in and pay and she gets ducked in the fountain.

199.title: Freckles and His Friends
199.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The girls take the limousine home, saying "This is our answer to TWIRP Season."

200.title: Freckles and His Friends
200.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The explanation that it's TWIRP Season doesn't impress the headwaiter, and the boys are all put to washing dishes.

201.title: Freckles and His Friends
201.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The bill has been whittled down some by dishwashing, and Nutty plans to invent potatoes that come without skins.

202.title: Freckles and His Friends
202.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Victims of TWIRP Season revenge, the boys try to pool their funds and cover the $78 check, and come up with 86 cents.

203.title: Freckles and His Friends
203.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The girls gloat about outsmarting the boys, and then they have a flat tire.

204.title: Freckles and His Friends
204.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The boys are thumbing home from the TWIRP Season protest, and the truck driver tells them he's getting married tonight. They advise against it.

205.title: Freckles and His Friends
205.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles tells the story of the TWIRP Season protest to his family, and Tag announces that his piggy bank is not going to market.

206.title: Freckles and His Friends
206.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Driving back to Larkspur to bathe more crockery, Lard and Freckles come across a stuck car.

207.title: Freckles and His Friends
207.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The headwaiter from the Northridge Hotel is the driver of the stuck car, and he says it's worth $15 to him to get pushed out of the mudhole.

208.title: Freckles and His Friends
208.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: The waiter gives them 50 cents, though he said it was worth $15 dollars to be pushed out of the mud.

209.title: Freckles and His Friends
209.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Now the boys are stuck and can't make it to the hotel to wash dishes, but the chiseling waiter gives them a tow.

210.title: Freckles and His Friends
210.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Angry at being tricked and towed by the waiter, Freckles hits the brakes and his own car starts to come apart.

211.title: Freckles and His Friends
211.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles and Lard show up to wash dishes, then Lard drops a stack of plates and they're told to leave and never come back.

212.title: Freckles and His Friends
212.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles and Lard push the car home in the moonlight, ruminating about how TWIRP Season backfired, and resolve to boycott all whistle-bait, and break their resolutions as soon as they get home.

213.title: Freckles and His Friends
213.author: [No author]
213.series: May 14, 1957) Original comic art : sample collection of artwork for various U.S. comic strips.
notes: ca. 40 items in box 63 x 53 x 9 cm.

214.title: Freckles and His Friends
214.author: Merrill Blosser
214.appears_in: p. 318 in The National Cartoonists Society Album 1996 ed.
notes: Summary: Freckles and June are blowing bubbles on the porch, a relief from their "silly jitterbugging."

215.title: Freckles and His Friends
215.author: Merrill Blosser
215.appears_in: p. 12 in The National Cartoonists Society Album 1965 ed.
notes: Summary: New neighbor Nila Dotkins is a girl of few words, but she immediately wants June to introduce her to Freckles.

216.title: Freckles and His Friends
216.author: Henry Formhals.
216.series: Dec. 23, 1966) "It's Stuck to the Golf Club!"*
notes: Summary: They may have invented a golf ball that can't be lost.

217.title: Freckles and His Friends
217.author: Henry Formhals.
217.series: June 2, 1970) "One Thing I Can't Stand is a Clever Ad-libber"*
notes: Summary: Pepi the goat and the Scotty dog trade insults about body odor and fleas.

224.title: Index entry to Cartoonist Profiles, no. 27
224.author: [No author]
notes: Data from R.C. Harvey.

225.heading: Freckles and His Friends--Miscellanea.
225.title: Index entry to Cartoonist Profiles, no. 28
225.author: [No author]
notes: Data from R.C. Harvey.

239.heading: Freckles and His Friends--Parodies, Imitations, Etc.
239.title: "Freckles and His Friends" p. 68-69 in Sex in Comics, v. 1
239.author: by D
239.appears_in: H. Gilmore (San Diego, Calif. : Greenleaf Classics, 1971)
notes: A Tijuana Bible reprint. k. Tijuana Bibles. Call no.: PN6714.G5 1971 v.1

240.title: Freckles Marvel
240.author: Jack Binder, art ; Otto Binder, script
notes: Guest starring Freckles Marvel
Data from Lou Mougin of Grand Comic-Book Database. I. Binder, Jack. II. Binder, Otto. III. Mary Marvel. k. Lies. k. Freckles Marvel. Call no.: Film 15791, r.83

242.heading: Frecksay, Ladislaus von.
242.title: History of the Comic Strip, v. 2
242.author: by David Kunzle

243.title: Freak Show
notes: Story by Bruce Jones and Bernie Wrightson, serialized in Heavy Metal (1982-1983)
